title: Requires reporting by entities other than state agencies that purchase commodities or services through a contract with the office of general services
summary: Requires reporting by entities other than state agencies that purchase commodities or services through a contract with the office of general services.

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. BRENNAN, CAHILL, JAFFEE -- Multi-Sponsored by --
         M. of A. COLTON, DESTITO, GALEF, GOTTFRIED, LUPARDO, MILLMAN, PHEFFER,
         SWEENEY, WEISENBERG -- read once and  referred  to  the  Committee  on
         Governmental Operations

       AN  ACT to amend the state finance law, in relation to entities purchas-
         ing through office of general services contracts

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 163 of the state finance law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 10-a to read as follows:
    3    10-A.    REPORTING  TO  THE OFFICE OF GENERAL SERVICES.  ANY OFFICE OF
    4  GENERAL SERVICES CONTRACT THROUGH WHICH COMMODITIES OR SERVICES  MAY  BE
    5  PURCHASED  BY AN ENTITY OTHER THAN A STATE AGENCY SHALL REQUIRE THAT THE
    6  VENDOR REPORT SUCH PURCHASES TO THE OFFICE  OF  GENERAL  SERVICES  ON  A
    7  QUARTERLY  BASIS.  THE  VENDOR'S REPORT SHALL SPECIFY FOR EACH PURCHASE,
    8  THE ITEMS PURCHASED, THE NUMBER OF PURCHASES AND THE AMOUNT OF  EXPENDI-
    9  TURES.  THE  OFFICE OF GENERAL SERVICES SHALL REPORT SUCH INFORMATION TO
   10  THE OFFICE OF THE STATE COMPTROLLER ON A QUARTERLY BASIS. THE OFFICE  OF
   11  THE  STATE  COMPTROLLER  SHALL INCLUDE SUCH INFORMATION IN ITS REPORTING
   12  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FOURTEEN OF THIS SECTION.
   13    S 2. Paragraph (i) of subdivision 14  of  section  163  of  the  state
   14  finance law, as amended by chapter 95 of the laws of 2000, is amended to
   15  read as follows:
   16    (i)  a  listing  of  individual  and  centralized contracts, including
   17  vendor name, comptroller approval dates, dollar value of such contracts,
   18  the state agency which let the  contract  and/or  state  agencies  which
   19  purchased  off centralized contracts, OTHER ENTITIES WHICH PURCHASED OFF
   20  CENTRALIZED CONTRACTS, expenditures made on each such  contract  and  by
   21  which  agencies  OR  OTHER  ENTITIES  during the fiscal year and life to
   22  date, citing contract category codes, source selection method, including
   23  "lowest price", "best value", sole source, single source, negotiated and

    4  ments to section 163 of the state finance law made by sections  one  and
    5  two of this act shall not affect the repeal of such section and shall be
    6  deemed repealed therewith.
